channel.title: Michael Ofei
channel.description: Essays on content, editorial leadership, and building things.

item.title: The Content Library
item.description: A content library is the collection of crystallized thinking you build over time. It might be the most important asset you can build right now, because it's the one thing that survives when platforms shift.

item.title: The Tour Method
item.description: Create something worth touring. Then tour it everywhere. How artists, companies, and creators build lasting authority by front-loading effort and distributing relentlessly.

item.title: Story Triggers
item.description: Most people feel story triggers every day and never realize there's machinery underneath. Once you see them, you can't unsee them.

item.title: Building a Mirror
item.description: What shipping my first app taught me about time, awareness, and becoming a builder.

item.title: Why Helpful Content Gets Forgotten
item.description: Comprehensive content serves the immediate intent. Thesis-driven content shifts how you think. That's what survives the forgetting.

item.title: Speaking Expands, Typing Compresses
item.description: When you type, you compress. When you speak, you expand. For AI collaboration, expanding is a cheat code.

item.title: Claude Code for Writers
item.description: Claude Code isn't really about code. It's about directing context. And that realization changed how I work.

item.title: The Lens Method: Collaborative Authority in Content
item.description: Expert experience is raw light. The writer provides the lensâ€”deciding what matters, what connects, and what it means for a specific audience.
